titleStmt.title: John D. Taylor and G. P. Metcalfe
CWG8665

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: I recd your letter touching Brookover's petition to remit a fine, the execution is in the hands of the sheriff and he is pressing its collection the return day is the 1st of March, will you see the Governor and ascertain what he will do I hope he may suspend its collection for as long a time as he can & we have in the meantime prosecute an appeal please attend to this & write me immediately
Suspend collection of fine in this case for six months
